channel.title: Java guide
channel.description: Does anyone know a good java guide? Not a runescape guide, don't get me wrong. What I mean is I want to program a RSPS but I want to be able to add new stuff to it, rather than just doing stuff that's already been done. To fulfill this goal I must learn java. And I'm looking for a guide that isn't too complicated. But isn't just simple, like if it has 5 pages on commenting I find it useless. Thanks in advance =)

item.title: Java guide
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“public boolean, post:6, topic:267801”]This is the server help section Not requesting, if you wish to find a useful guide on java try searching for it, we dont Spoon-feed here.
Try www.google.com,[/quote]
He was simply asking for a guide. If a member wants to learn, we should help them. I don’t consider this as spoon feeding.

Read full topic

item.title: Java guide
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

I never knew telling someone where to find the answer was the same as spoonfeeding? That is the whole point of the help section, helping people.

Read full topic

item.title: Java guide
item.dc:creator: @Java6 Java © ?
item.description:
@Java6 wrote:

[quote=“Nuke207, post:4, topic:267801”]Thanks, I’ll check them out
Though I just remembered that I rather getting taught by a “person” , like … ask them questions and stuff.
But I’ll give it a go![/quote]

Haha… Pretty sure everyone would prefer that and there are forums you can go to but read through that first if you are serious about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Java guide
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

xx qwertyuiop xx:

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial

I back this up. You can find just about anything to do with Java programming by looking in this tutorial. You can even download the entire tutorials. If you need to refer to a single class, you can look at the Java API.

Read full topic
